title: Failure-Based Learning and Teacher Collaboration Strategies for Innovating Mathematics Education in Large-Scale Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary mathematics education theory and teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: Aimed at pre-service teachers or mathematics education researchers, focusing on developing innovative strategies applicable in real classroom settings

learning_goals: Learners can design creative approaches to improve mathematics education by analyzing failure cases
Learners can systematically conduct lesson design feedback using the teacher collaboration (StoryCircles) method
Learners can reconstruct problem situations that occurred during mathematics classes using various educational materials (class records, student responses, etc.) and derive improvement strategies
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
